testcase.name: testPlaceOrder

error.message:
Mockito cannot mock this class: class org.springframework.kafka.core.KafkaTemplate.
If you're not sure why you're getting this error, please open an issue on GitHub.
Java : 23 JVM vendor name : Oracle Corporation JVM vendor version : 23.0.1+11-39 JVM name : Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM JVM version : 23.0.1+11-39 JVM info : mixed mode, sharing OS name : Windows 11 OS version : 10.0
You are seeing this disclaimer because Mockito is configured to create inlined mocks. You can learn about inline mocks and their limitations under item #39 of the Mockito class javadoc.
Underlying exception : org.mockito.exceptions.base.MockitoException: Could not modify all classes [class org.springframework.kafka.core.KafkaTemplate, interface org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, interface org.springframework.kafka.core.KafkaOperations, interface org.springframework.context.ApplicationListener, interface java.util.EventListener, interface org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean, class java.lang.Object, interface org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware, interface org.springframework.beans.factory.SmartInitializingSingleton, interface org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware]
